question: Are women allowed to offer their salaah in congregation by themselves in their own homes?
answer:
QUESTION
Are women allowed to offer their salaah in congregation by themselves in their own homes? ie. The imaam will be a woman and all females will follow behind her. Like this are females allowed to perform taraweeh in this manner. Jazakallh
ANSWER


Share:
It is Makrooh for women to perform Salaat in a congregation of females only even in Taraweeh Salaat. (Shaami vol.1 pg.565)

Sayyidatuna Aaisha (Radhiallaahu Anha) reports that Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) said, ?There is no good in the congregation of females except in the main Musjid (with men) or in Janaaza.? (Musnad Ahmad & Tabrani ? see I?elaa-us-sunan vol.4 pg.242)

Sayyiduna Ali (Radhiallaahu Anhu) is also authentically reported to have prohibited this. (Ibid).

One of the reasons mentioned by the Fuqahaa is that the Imaam will have to stand in the middle of the first Saff. This act in itself is Makrooh. There is no proof to show that the female Imaam should stand in front. (I?elaa-us-sunan)

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Moulana Muhammad ibn Moulana Haroon Abassommar
FACULATY OF SPCECIALTY IN HADITH SCIENCES
